Interface BonjourBrowserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BonjourBrowserImpl

    public interface BonjourBrowserInterface
    Interface defining operations for managing Bonjour service discovery UI. Provides methods for adding, removing, and updating service nodes in the browser tree.

    This interface supports two types of nodes:

    • General nodes: Represent service types (e.g., "_http._tcp."). These are discovered via the meta-query and shown as expandable folders.
    • Service nodes: Represent individual service instances. These are discovered when a service type is expanded and can be resolved for details.

    Thread Safety: Implementations must be thread-safe. Methods may be called from any thread (including DNSSD callback threads). Implementations should dispatch Swing operations to the Event Dispatch Thread (EDT) internally.

    See Also:
    BonjourBrowserImpl, BonjourBrowserElement

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addGeneralNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
      Adds a general service type node to the browser tree.
      boolean addNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
      Adds a service instance node to the browser tree.
      boolean removeGeneralNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
      Removes a general service type node from the browser tree.
      boolean removeNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
      Removes a service instance node from the browser tree.
      boolean resolveNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
      Updates a service instance node with resolved information.
      boolean subscribe(java.lang.String domain, java.lang.String regType)
      Subscribes to a service type to discover individual service instances.

    • Method Detail

      • addGeneralNode

        boolean addGeneralNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
        Adds a general service type node to the browser tree. Creates the domain and service type hierarchy if not already present.
        Parameters:
        element - BonjourBrowserElement containing regType and domain (typically created from meta-query results)
        Returns:
        true if the operation was initiated successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • removeGeneralNode

        boolean removeGeneralNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
        Removes a general service type node from the browser tree. Also removes the parent domain node if it becomes empty.
        Parameters:
        element - BonjourBrowserElement containing regType and domain identifying the node to remove
        Returns:
        true if the operation was initiated successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • addNode

        boolean addNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
        Adds a service instance node to the browser tree. The node is added under its service type (regType) within its domain.
        Parameters:
        element - BonjourBrowserElement containing fullName, name, regType, and domain (created when a service is found, not yet resolved)
        Returns:
        true if the operation was initiated successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
        Removes a service instance node from the browser tree. Also removes parent nodes (regType, domain) if they become empty.
        Parameters:
        element - BonjourBrowserElement containing fullName, name, regType, and domain identifying the service instance to remove
        Returns:
        true if the operation was initiated successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • resolveNode

        boolean resolveNode(BonjourBrowserElement element)
        Updates a service instance node with resolved information. Adds child nodes showing hostname:port and TXT record entries.
        Parameters:
        element - BonjourBrowserElement containing fullName, hostname, port, and txtRecord (created when a service is resolved)
        Returns:
        true if the operation was initiated successfully, false if the node was not found
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null

      • subscribe

        boolean subscribe(java.lang.String domain,
                  java.lang.String regType)
        Subscribes to a service type to discover individual service instances. Clears existing children under the service type and starts browsing for services of that type.

        This is typically called when the user expands a service type node in the browser tree.

        Parameters:
        domain - the service domain (e.g., "local.")
        regType - the service type to browse (e.g., "_http._tcp.")
        Returns:
        true if subscription started successfully, false on error
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if domain or regType is null
